channel.title: Aaah help can't load windows anymore!
channel.description: ALRIGHT, I wanted to uninstall linux so instead of reading anything I deleted the partition it was installed on, cleeearly not a bright idea at all. So everything was going good then I decided to restart my computer. Now I get something like "Grub error 22", I can't even load up the system reformat thing with F10, I can only go into the setup which doesn't seem to help. Right now using linux off the cd, any suggestions!!

item.title: Aaah help can't load windows anymore!
item.dc:creator: @james james
item.description:
@james wrote:

sdouble:

Yeah, you’ll need the password for the “Administrator” account to do it. I haven’t done that for quite some time so I don’t remember if it gives you the choice or automatically does it. I know the command for it is “fixmbr”

just make a admin account using command prompt

although i have never used linux so idk if you can

item.title: Aaah help can't load windows anymore!
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

If you have a Windows XP CD, set your bios to boot of the CD drive, then boot off the CD (o.O), and press R (recovery console). You should be able to repair your MBR (Master Boot Record) so it just starts XP automatically. If you don’t have a Windows CD, then I’m afraid you’ll have to go buy one (or download illegally).

Read full topic
